intro: Hypocalymma strictum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a perennial shrub that produces fruit in the form of a capsule, which contains seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species in some regions.
